tags: i'm pretty sure caleb's amulet also protects against locate person as well
summary: I love spell components and descriptions of them so much, which is one of the things I love about this campaign Anyway a v...
body:
I love spell components and descriptions of them so much, which is one of the things I love about this campaign

Anyway a v stupid headcanon I have is that, since scrying is done using a crystal ball or mirror, Caleb’s anti-scrying amulet is an inverted mirror. Like the silver is painted on front of the glass, not in between the glass and metal backing

I love spell components and descriptions of them so much, which is one of the things I love about this campaign

Anyway a v stupid headcanon I have is that, since scrying is done using a crystal ball or mirror, Caleb’s anti-scrying amulet is an inverted mirror. Like the silver is painted on front of the glass, not in between the glass and metal backing

blog.description: Siobhan, but you can call me Shivvy They/Them (alternatively stell/stei/stellar/stellars/stellself) Professional Nott Lover™️ Sidebar gif belongs to @molly-yasha Queue tag is Queue-duceus.

summary: Inspired by @theres-no-comma ‘s Beau being adopted by the Brenattos but the plot... Still goes down; Fjord is taken in by the...
body:
Inspired by @theres-no-comma ‘s Beau being adopted by the Brenattos but the plot… Still goes down;

Fjord is taken in by the Brenattos, just for a couple years. Veth and Yeza care for him but eventually, they’re going to have to let him go. He goes back to the Menagerie Coast, does work on a ship… And everything still happens.

Everything still happens to Veth and Yeza as well. Eventually, Fjord and Veth - now a goblin girl by the name of Nott - meet. They become a party together, and Nott is way more antagonistic towards Fjord. After all, she knows he’s lying about a lot of things - shitty state-run orphanage? a fake accent? 

But she too has to lie. She doesn’t want to tell Fjord that she is Veth, the woman who cared for him at a young age. He’s kidnapped and her mind goes back to Luke and Yeza and she can’t lose someone else. They’re on the boat and he’s being manipulated by his patron and Avantica, and Nott hands him a vial of acid to throw in Avantica’s face, the same method that worked on the goblins as she was running away.

And still… And still…

They go back to Felderwin. In the basement of Brenatto Apothecary, as well as blaming Caleb, Nott starts screaming at Fjord;

“I’ve known you since you were a child! And you… You keep… WHY? Why do you do this?”

“I have no idea what she’s talking about-“

And neither does the party. Caleb is still catatonic, the rest are trying to pick up the pieces and Fjord is shell-shocked… The woman who cared from him at a young age is missing, as is her husband, as is the boy he thought of as a brother… But it still doesn’t click until they get to Old Edith’s.

Nott disguises herself. Fjord’s eyes widen in shock and he stumbles back, gripping his chest and swallowing slightly. Oh shit… This is what she meant.

“Edith, it’s me. Where’s my son?” 

And that’s when he nearly coughs up more salt water than he would in his nightmares.

 Nott… Is Veth? The halfling woman who took him in as a child… 

She knew. She knew this whole time.

“Mum?” He whispers, not even bothering to hide his accent this time around. He doesn’t care. This is her. And she’s alive.

blog.name: bixbiboom
blog.title: I myself am also Enchanter Pumat Sol
blog.description:
Bixbi, older than you.

Fat queer of indeterminate origin.

Possibly a lesser demon.

Hellenist serving Hestia, Hermes and Chiron.

Critical Role has taken over my life and my blog.

Taliesin Jaffe is my boyfriend.

I love you.

#eyesnevershut

summary: I finally got around to watching the Talks Machina from episode 54, and let me just say, to have it confirmed that Emily...
body: I finally got around to watching the Talks Machina from episode 54, and let me just say, to have it confirmed that Emily Axford/Moonshine Cybin would have made the EXACT same goldfish-cliff-diving mistake that Marisha/Keyleth made is TREMENDOUSLY validating.

reblog.comment: I finally got around to watching the Talks Machina from episode 54, and let me just say, to have it confirmed that Emily Axford/Moonshine Cybin would have made the EXACT same goldfish-cliff-diving mistake that Marisha/Keyleth made is TREMENDOUSLY validating.

trail.content_raw: I finally got around to watching the Talks Machina from episode 54, and let me just say, to have it confirmed that Emily Axford/Moonshine Cybin would have made the EXACT same goldfish-cliff-diving mistake that Marisha/Keyleth made is TREMENDOUSLY validating.
trail.content: I finally got around to watching the Talks Machina from episode 54, and let me just say, to have it confirmed that Emily Axford/Moonshine Cybin would have made the EXACT same goldfish-cliff-diving mistake that Marisha/Keyleth made is TREMENDOUSLY validating.

blog.name: saltwaterwarlock
blog.title: mage rights or mage fights
blog.description: Simona || 21 || she/they || Zemni Fields || talk to me about critical role :)

tags: if you feel this way about another character
dark!jester? tempted by the traveler to go down a path that leads into darkness?
zealous beau whose pursuit of justice leads her to making decisions and sacrificing lives for what she thinks is the greater good?
molly hunting down everyone who had to do with lucien and his past because he wants to eradicate everything from before
summary: okay but am i the only one who wants to really read a dark au where fjord is completely devoted to uko’toa? maybe he’s never met...
body:
okay but am i the only one who wants to really read a dark au where fjord is completely devoted to uko’toa?

maybe he’s never met vandren. maybe he hired onto another ship, with a captain who didn’t give a shit about him. 

and he grew bitter and resentful. even when he proved his worth over and over again, people just didn’t look past the green skin and the tusks he sometimes forgets to file down far enough

even his crewmates give him weird looks, months after he joined

so when the ship sinks, and fjord almost dies, he wakes up and he feels proud

he was chosen

he is special. he is better.

and with his patron at his side, he’ll show the entire world

summary:
jeli-jelly
 replied to your post  “though honestly, as TERRIBLE as last night got, things (unbelievably)...”
                   ...
body:
jeli-jelly replied to your post “though honestly, as TERRIBLE as last night got, things (unbelievably)…”
And I’m pretty sure that if you’ve been charmed and/or succeeded in a save against the charm you are immune to that effect for the rest of the day

yeah, i picked up on that! thank GOODNESS honestly, imagine how OP the succubus/incubus would be if that wasn’t the case… would certainly make for a frustrating fight

summary:
rashnorkthings
 replied to your post  “also hey are we gonna talk about beau’s comment about “having to kill”...”
              ...
body:
rashnorkthings replied to your post “also hey are we gonna talk about beau’s comment about “having to kill”…”
i think Beau meant her and Nott having to kill Caleb since their the only ones who know his story and the reason why he might turn on them

oh, totally. they’re the only two who know how deeply Fucked caleb’s past is, and to a degree his mindset. but (while beau and nott seem reasonably aware of caleb’s potentially bad long term plans) why would THAT make beau think that, on a whim, caleb would just fireball the entire party? you know what, nott also wasn’t sure that was “uncharacteristic” behaviour… but anyway, his main “threat” would be if he decides to fuck with reality, which is an EXTREMELY long term goal that even HE’S not certain of. so i just find it curious that beau is apparently ready for caleb to explicitly (not just incidentally, as it likely would be with fucking with reality) and maliciously turn on them.

though it’s cute that even though she was worried this was the case she just held his hand and tried to talk to him instead of punching him in the face

rashnorkthings replied to your post “also hey are we gonna talk about beau’s comment about “having to kill”…”

i think Beau meant her and Nott having to kill Caleb since their the only ones who know his story and the reason why he might turn on them

oh, totally. they’re the only two who know how deeply Fucked caleb’s past is, and to a degree his mindset. but (while beau and nott seem reasonably aware of caleb’s potentially bad long term plans) why would THAT make beau think that, on a whim, caleb would just fireball the entire party? you know what, nott also wasn’t sure that was “uncharacteristic” behaviour… but anyway, his main “threat” would be if he decides to fuck with reality, which is an EXTREMELY long term goal that even HE’S not certain of. so i just find it curious that beau is apparently ready for caleb to explicitly (not just incidentally, as it likely would be with fucking with reality) and maliciously turn on them.

though it’s cute that even though she was worried this was the case she just held his hand and tried to talk to him instead of punching him in the face

summary: i am not a good artist, but i have this image in my head of the incubus with molly’s face whispering to yasha, “they told you...
body: i am not a good artist, but i have this image in my head of the incubus with molly’s face whispering to yasha, “they told you lorenzo killed me? and you believed them?” and i might have to stretch out my wrists and give it a shot.
